abstract: Profile of Loretta E Lynch, Pres Obama's nominee to succeed Eric H Holder Jr as attorney general, who differs from Holder in that she is more a traditional prosecutor than a civil rights advocate; African-American who grew up in the segregated south, she went on to graduate from Harvard Law School in 1984.
lead_paragraph: Friends say Loretta E. Lynch, an African-American reared in the segregated South, sees herself more as a traditional prosecutor than a civil rights advocate.
snippet: Friends say Loretta E. Lynch, an African-American reared in the segregated South, sees herself more as a traditional prosecutor than a civil rights advocate.

headline.main: Nominee for Attorney General Less an Activist Than Holder
headline.seo: Loretta Lynch Said to See Her Role as That of Traditional Prosecutor
headline.print_headline: Nominee for Attorney General Less an Activist Than Holder
